title: Suspect says Westwood homicide was an accident
content:
CINCINNATI —
Cincinnati police have arrested a 23-year-old man in connection with a Saturday morning shooting in Westwood.
Donta Williams, 23, was arrested around 6 p.m.
Police said Williams shot and killed Derrick Johnson, 23, on Saturday morning.
Johnson was found around 9 a.m. in a car that had crashed into a pole near 3262 Tulsa Court. He was pronounced dead at the scene.
In court Monday, Williams' attorney said the shooting was an accident, and that Johnson was Williams' cousin.
Bond for Williams was set at $250,000.
